variants.Description in input context: The SOD1 p.E201 mutation was identified in patient samples.

Material used.Description: Fibroblasts were obtained from patients diagnosed with familial ALS carrying the SOD1 p.E201 mutation.

Readout description.Result Description: Immunofluorescence staining revealed increased SOD1 aggregation in fibroblasts carrying the NM_000434.4:c.602G>A mutation compared to control fibroblasts.  The area of aggregated protein was visibly expanded.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent cell lines from different patients with the SOD1 mutation were used.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was imaged three times independently.

Basic positive control.Description: Fibroblasts expressing a tagged SOD1 mutant known to aggregate were included as a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Wild-type SOD1 expressing fibroblasts were included as a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Quantification of fluorescence intensity was performed using ImageJ software and analyzed using a Studentâ€™s t-test.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Area of SOD1 staining less than 50 arbitrary units.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Area of SOD1 staining greater than 150 arbitrary units.
